title: How to Create Options or Choices in a Batch File

steps.title: Type the following, careless of bolded/unbolded worlds.
steps.content: Type the following, careless of bolded/unbolded worlds. After each press enter. Anything in parenthesis do NOT type, these are side-notes that tries to explain the steps.

steps.title: @echo off (This command will 'hide' the command input - optional but recommended)
steps.content: @echo off (This command will 'hide' the command input - optional but recommended)

steps.title: cls (This will clear anything above - optional but recommended if you're wanting to make it look neat) start
steps.content: cls (This will clear anything above - optional but recommended if you're wanting to make it look neat) start

steps.title: echo Choice 1 ("Choice 1" can be renamed to whatever you want, any of the choices)
steps.content: echo Choice 1 ("Choice 1" can be renamed to whatever you want, any of the choices)

steps.title: echo Choice 3 (Keep doing that until you have all of the choices that you need.
steps.content: echo Choice 3 (Keep doing that until you have all of the choices that you need. )

steps.title: Type "set /p choice=(Insert question or command here, like "Yes or no?"
steps.content: Type "set /p choice=(Insert question or command here, like "Yes or no?" )

steps.title: (Continue doing this pattern until you have enough.
steps.content: (Continue doing this pattern until you have enough. Then type:)

steps.title: echo "%choice%" is not a valid option.
steps.content: echo "%choice%" is not a valid option. Please try again.

steps.title: Continue doing this pattern until you have completed the file.
steps.content: Continue doing this pattern until you have completed the file. end

steps.title: Save this as a .bat file.
steps.content: Save this as a .bat file. Double click to test your batch file.
